for digital apparatus. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference in a
residential installation. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed
and used in accordance with the instructions, may cause harmful interference to radio communications.

However, there is no guarantee that interference will not occur in a particular installation. If this equipment does
cause harmful interference to radio or television reception, which can be determined by turning the equipment off
and on, the user is encouraged to try to correct the interference by one or more of the following measures:
- Reorient or relocate the receiving antenna.
- Increase the separation between the equipment and receiver.
- Connect the equipment into an outlet on a circuit different from that to which the receiver is connected.
- Consult the dealer or an experienced radio/T.V. technician for help.

Silicon Software GmbH is not responsible for any radio television inter-ference caused by unauthorized modifications
of this equipment or the substitution or attachment of connecting cables and equipment other than those specified by
Silicon Software GmbH. The correction of interference caused by such unauthorized modification, substitution or attachment
will be the responsibility of the user. The use of shielded I/O cables is required when connecting this equipment to any and all
optional peripheral or host devices. Failure to do so may violate FCC and ICES rules.

4 Power over Feature (Camera Link, GigE Vision)

4.1 Power of CameraLink (PoCL)

only mE4 VD4-PoCL

The microEnable IV VD4-PoCL frame grabber supports Power over CameraLink (PoCL) cameras. The implementation is backward compatibel to the standard CameraLink, so both PoCL and standard CameraLink cameras can be used. Only two pins of the CameraLink connector are different (pins 1 & 26) for the two standards. These two pins are used as ground for standard CameraLink and as 12V supply voltage in the PoCL case.

The microEnable IV VD4-PoCL frame grabber has a special connector at the rear end that has to be connected to supply the PoCL power outputs. This connector can be connected to a standard floppy power connector of a PC power supply.
(Connector Type: Tyco 171826-4. Pin 1: not connected, pin 2: GND, pin 3: GND, pin 4: 12V)

To prevent any damage from the camera and grabber a PoCL SafePower system is implemented. PoCL SafePower automatically detects the presence of a PoCL cable and camera to allow safe switching of the 12V camera power. Port A and port B of the grabber are autonomous and will be testet and supplied independently.

SafePower Operation:

  • The PoCL camera has a defined 4k7 input impedance between connector pins 1 & 26 and ground.
  • Before driving either power or ground to the camera the frame grabber drives out a defined 0.1 mA sense current via connector pins 1 & 26, and after a defined time delay, senses the resulting voltage.
  • If a PoCL camera and cable is connected, the sense current will result in a voltage across the defined input impedance of the camera. The frame grabber senses this voltage, and therefore supplies 12V to the connector pins 1 & 26, powering the PoCL camera.
  • If a non-PoCL camera or cable is connected, the sense current will drive a short circuit, and 0V will be sensed. The frame grabber then grounds connector pins 1 & 26, giving compatibility with the CameraLink standard.
  • For presence detection of a camera the SafePower system monitors the pixel clock. If no pixel clock is present for more than ca. 0.5 seconds the connector pins 1 & 26 will be set in high-impedance mode and testing is started again.

The state of the SafePower system can be seen on the LEDs on the backside of the grabber. During test of the connector the PORT and the TEST LED are blinking. If a PoCL camera and cable is connected the PORT and 12V LED are on. For a non-PoCL camera or cable the PORT and GND LED are on.

Although the PowerSafe system automatically detects and switches the power it is not recommended to plug and unplug cables or cameras when the frame grabber is powered.

The 12 V, which is neccessary for the PoCL camera, is feed into the board via a power connector on the back side of the board (Tyco 171826-4).
A standard floppy power connector from the PC power supply can be used.

Pin 1: not connected (5V on floppy power connector of ATX power supply)
Pin 2: GND
Pin 3: GND
Pin 4: 12 V




4.1 Power of Ethernet (PoE)

only mE4 VQ4-GPoE

The microEnable IV AQ4-GPoE frame grabber supports Power over Ethernet (PoE) cameras. A power supply is used to provide up to 150 Watt (aggregated via all four GigE ports). Please detailled information on available power supply modules please contact SiliconSoftware sales department or your local distributor.

Currently the following power supply is available (max. 30 Watt aggregated via all four GigabitEthernet ports):

PoE Power Supply, internal, 30 Watt:

- Internal power supply for microEnable AQ4-GPoE and VQ4-GPoE.
- Requires 12V input (4pin Molex connector) and delivers 48V. Supports up to 30W in total.
- Slot mounting (PS PoE30ISL, see image above) or HDD mounting (PS PoE30IHD) versions available (optional).
- Power cable "SATA connector -> 4pin Molex connector" (optional)




microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE with connected power supply (slot bracket version)




microEnable IV VQ4-GPoE with connected power supply (3.5“ HDD slot version)

For Area Cameras: Image Trigger (ExSync)

For Area Cameras: HD Sync

User Output (Digital Out Bit #0)		 GND 8

For Area Cameras: Image Trigger (ExSync)

21 Trigger Output 6 Port B
For Area Cameras: HD Sync
For Line Cameras: Line Trigger (ExSync)		 GND 22
23 Trigger Output 7 Port B
User Output (Digital Out Bit #1)		 GND 24
25 Trigger Input 4 Port B GND 26
27 Trigger Input 5 Port B GND 28
29 Trigger Input 6 Port B GND 30
31 Trigger Input 7 Port B VCCIO (+2.5V) 32
33 Presence Detect VCCIO (+2.5V) 34

 Plug assignment of the trigger plug (34 pin flat cable).

Default I/O configuration: 2.5V logic level signals (LVCMOS25). Signals are driven by open-collector drivers, pullups are on-board.

Optional I/O configuration only for microEnable IV VD4-CL/-PoCL: 3.3V TTL (LVTTL) compatible I/Os (push/pull). VCCIO on Pin 32 and 34: +3.3V.
-- Please note, that this configuration DOES NOT support the connection of two or more microEnable IV frame grabber via the flat cable!! --
If you are interested in this optional configuration please contact SiliconSoftware sales department or your local distributor.




10 LED Description

There are several LEDs mounted on the board. The most important one is the "DONE" LED.

If the "DONE" LED is on, the frame grabber is ready for operation:

  • The FPGA on the frame grabber has been configured successfully.
  • The frame grabber identifies itself as a PCIe board and is recognized by the PC.
  • Under Windows, it is detected by the Device Manager.




11 Important Note Regarding PCIe Bus Data Through-Put

The PCIe bus data throughput depends on the motherboard, the chip set and the BIOS configuration of the PC and can differ from slot to slot. It can also depend on the number of installed PCIe-boards.
The actual bandwidth of a micoEnable IV frame grabber in a PCIe slot using a certain applet can be measured with the tool microDiagnostics.
